title: @Jaredan About Zyra
body:
I understand that _many_ champions could use either new lore, addition of lore, or some tweaks to their story after the retcon. However everyone is most curious about their favorite champion and so I have to ask, will (at the very least) Zyra {{champion:143}}  be included in the pool of champions receiving lore related changes? By no means is her current lore "lacking" per se.  It's just really open ended. Zyra fans understand she's a being of terrible beauty and power and not to mention ancient. She probably has a degree of naiveté as well.  I think there's a lot of potential possibilities for her. 

In her lore, the last we know is she's free to roam Valoran independently. I'd _love _ to know her potential perspective and experiences with her new surroundings. What are her motivations? (other than "observing" or experiencing the new world around her). Is there any realization about the impact she might have?  Is she discovering how much she's capable of and/or incorporating her abilities into the world around her? Any factions she's encountered and either dismissed or harmonized with them? Or is she too wild to ally herself with any civilized community? What's her level of intelligence and communication?

replies.body:
Zyra isn't high on our priority list right now, but she will be getting a fresh coat of story paint (sorry, it's early and I've got my first cup of coffee waiting for me).  I agree with you that there are some very strong possibilities with her, (PBJ's post below being an excellent example), and we'll be looking to show how she's responding to the world around her.

Sorry that I can't be more concrete than that for now, but some of the Champs are in more urgent need than Zyra.
More urgent story wise or will these champions be primarily updated with visual and gameplay changes?

I'm talking purely from a story and background perspective. However, these will cross over with the work being done by ChampUp, which Narrative contributes to, and also includes VU, VO, and kit updates. One of the determining factors for prioritization on a champion introduction rewrite is if that Champion is in the ChampUp pipeline.

Would it be possible to get a rough schedule, like the ChampUp schedule, for some of the future non-event based lore updates? Or would that be too difficult to formulate and nail down? If so it is understandable.
Yeah that's not really possible at the moment, sorry.

I understand! I'm sure drafting and editing is a nightmare. - I follow along some of my favorite authors' blogs (GRRM and Patrick Rothfuss) and get some idea about the pain of editing and deadlines from that. Just thought I might ask and see if a broad pipeline was possible.

Question for ya Jaredan; Garen, Darius, Skarner and Morde are all getting some form of kit update really soon. Does this qualify them for a pass with the new style of Bio? Just curious because people have been wondering about it.
Yea, need to fix many lores which make no sense now since the destruction of IOW.

Hello :))
RIOTer response:
Her goals are to experience the world from her new perspective. For a being so ancient to suddenly change in such a dramatic fashion, it's like a complete rebirth. In this way, basic survival is still an issue, because she is experiencing the world anew.

RELATIONS:
Zyra looks down on Maokai. Personality-wise, Zyra is a predator, a killer, the wild fury of nature, whereas Maokai is the sturdy, defensive, protective force of nature. Zyra loves the power that her new "animal" form gives her, Maokai laments it. They might be the only ones able to show each other the merits of either form.

Ahri might be a subject of interest to Zyra, since there is some commonality to how they both came to be. Otherwise she would just be a many-tailed snack.

I'm also interested if Zyra has the mother nature personality like the community makes her appear to have.If you ever seen a discussion everbody talks of her likes she cares for other plants and nature.
I personally don't see her as much,more of a killer and predator.I could imagine her interfering if someone tries to destroyes a huge forest or eco-system,but nothing more.

Fingers crossed you get a RED. :D

Zyra lore is exactly like Ahri but instead of a fox is a plant.

Literally, read their lores, they stealed a human body in almost the same way

She never "stole" a human body. She _created_ a magical plant/human hybrid vessel (using the magic she obtained from devouring a sorceress) and transferred her consciousness into that new body.
what? I will need to read her lore again because i remember her using a human body.

I understand and agree that other champions are in dire need of lore updates. I just had to ask ;-). Her getting a fresh coat of story paint at some point was all I needed to know! Thank you Jaredan :)
